templates.name: ATM Peplink Template by HLA
templates.description:
Template Module Interfaces Simple (no ifXTable). This is the exact copy of Template Module Interfaces template with the exception that metrics from ifXTable are replaced with ifTable counters where possible. Use this template with devices where IF-MIB::ifXtable is not available. If supported by the host - use Template Module Interfaces template instead.

MIBs used:
IF-MIB

Known Issues:

  Description: 32bit counters are used in this template (since there is no ifXtable available). If busy interfaces return incorrect bits sent/received - set update interval to 1m or less.

Template tooling version used: 0.36

triggers.expression: last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/deviceTemperatureCelsius)>55 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.name: Temperature is high (temp  {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} > 55 ℃)

triggers.expression: avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmppingsec,3m)>500 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.name: ICMP: High ICMP ping response time {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} > 500

triggers.expression: avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmppingsec,3m)>1000 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.name: ICMP: High ICMP ping response time {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} > 1000

triggers.expression: max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping[{$ATM_IPADDR}],5m)=0 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.name: Check Network Connection between ATM and Router.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound packets discarded
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded
even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.
One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system,
and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Inbound packets with errors
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.  For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Bits received
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The total number of octets received on the interface,including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occurat re-initialization of the management system, and atother times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound packets discarded
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded
even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.
One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.
Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system,
and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Outbound packets with errors
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.  For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Bits sent
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occurat re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Speed
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in bits per second.
For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made,
this object should contain the nominal bandwidth.
If the bandwidth of the interface is greater than the maximum value reportable by this object then
this object should report its maximum value (4,294,967,295) and ifHighSpeed must be used to report the interace's speed.
For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Operational status
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The current operational state of the interface.
- The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed
- If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2)
- If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic
- It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection)
- It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state
- It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototypes.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)
trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
trigger_prototypes.description:
This trigger expression works as follows:
1. Can be triggered if operations status is down.
2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.
3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)

WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Interface type
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: IF-MIB
The type of interface.
Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA),
through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototypes.expression:
change(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
and (
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117
)
and
(last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototypes.recovery_expression:
(change(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or
(last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototypes.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependencies.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependencies.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototypes.expression:
(avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or
avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototypes.recovery_expression:
avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and
avg(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototypes.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependencies.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependencies.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

trigger_prototypes.expression:
min(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
or min(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototypes.recovery_expression:
max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
and max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependencies.name: Interface {#IFDESCR}: Link down
dependencies.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))=1)

macros.description: Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default

triggers.expression:
max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping[{$ATM_IPADDR}],10m)=0
and
max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping,10m)=0 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.recovery_expression:
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping[{$ATM_IPADDR}])=1
and
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping)=1
triggers.name: ATM & Router DOWN

triggers.expression:
max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping[{$ATM_IPADDR}],10m)=0
and
max(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping,10m)=1 and (time() > 070000 and time() < 200000)
triggers.recovery_expression:
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping[{$ATM_IPADDR}])=1
and
last(/ATM Peplink Template by HLA/icmpping)=1
triggers.name: ATM DOWN
